extendedIngredients.name: bread
extendedIngredients.original: 1 loaf thinly sliced brown bread (such as Westphalian-style pumpernickel), lightly toasted, cut into triangles
extendedIngredients.originalName: thinly sliced brown bread (such as Westphalian-style pumpernickel), lightly toasted, cut into triangles

extendedIngredients.name: granny smith apple
extendedIngredients.original: 1 medium Granny Smith apple, peeled, cored, cut into matchstick-size strips
extendedIngredients.originalName: Granny Smith apple, peeled, cored, cut into matchstick-size strips

extendedIngredients.name: horseradish sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tablespoon (or more) finely grated peeled fresh horseradish or prepared horseradish sauce
extendedIngredients.originalName: (or more) finely grated peeled fresh horseradish or prepared horseradish sauce

extendedIngredients.name: smoked trout
extendedIngredients.original: 11 ounces smoked trout (about 3 fillets), coarsely flaked

title: Creamy Smoked Trout with Apple and Horseradish on Crisp Brown Bread
summary: Creamy Smoked Trout with Apple and Horseradish on Crisp Brown Bread is a pescatarian recipe with 12 servings. One portion of this dish contains around 12g of protein, 12g of fat, and a total of 280 calories. For $1.62 per serving, this recipe covers 13% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. If you have granny smith apple, cream, trout, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 42%. This score is pretty good. Try Smoked Trout Salad with Apples, Fennel and Creamy Horseradish Dressing, Smoked Trout with Apple-Horseradish Cream on Potato Pancakes, and Smoked Salmon with Apple-Horseradish Cream and Black Bread for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Mix trout, apple, celery, and chives in large bowl to blend. Whisk sour cream, mayonnaise, lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon horseradish in small bowl to blend. Fold horseradish mixture gently into trout mixture (do not break up trout). Season to taste with salt, pepper, and more horseradish if desired. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate.)                                                                Transfer trout mixture to serving bowl and place on platter. Surround with toasts and serve.

steps.step: Mix trout, apple, celery, and chives in large bowl to blend.

Whisk sour cream, mayonnaise, lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon horseradish in small bowl to blend. Fold horseradish mixture gently into trout mixture (do not break up trout). Season to taste with salt, pepper, and more horseradish if desired. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate.)
Transfer trout mixture to serving bowl and place on platter. Surround with toasts and serve.
